channel.title: Low-ram help
channel.description:
well im running on 500mb ram lol it fails. well i cant seem to find a decent source that wont make me ub3r laggy cause of my low ram.
post here decent servers (preferably delta not blank)

item.title: Low-ram help
item.dc:creator: @lord_fear lord_fear
item.description:
@lord_fear wrote:

Well, i was hosting a server on 512mb of ram and it seemed to work well, i could have around 50 players on my server at a time (due to the player cap i put on) and it seemed to work well… and yes, more RAM would be good due to the fact that it will be able to run the server at a much better speed…

Read full topic

item.title: Low-ram help
item.dc:creator: @crimim crimim
item.description:
@crimim wrote:

doesnt matter now i just got a frnd to host =D

Read full topic

item.title: Low-ram help
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“lord_fear, post:3, topic:344899”]Or you can do what most people would do with a bit of sence,
Download a blank source - i think one was released not a while ago,
And add stuff yourself to which you think your computer will be able to handle, that is a cheeper option, also remove any software that is un-needed and also delete any corrupt files as they can slow your computer down alot…
I will try and find you a blank source now.[/quote]

Fail, he will most likely use a WL source which can’t handle shit on a low ram computer. Just buy some more ram just so it can cover the running of the os, then you will have enough unused ram to handle a better built server like Hyperion, riotscape (WL but it makes the others look like shit), or another scratch. You want at least 1-2 gbs of ram for your server to be able to handle the players, skills, mini games, and other misc ram eaters.

Read full topic

item.title: Low-ram help
item.dc:creator: @lord_fear lord_fear
item.description:
@lord_fear wrote:

Or you can do what most people would do with a bit of sence,
Download a blank source - i think one was released not a while ago,
And add stuff yourself to which you think your computer will be able to handle, that is a cheeper option, also remove any software that is un-needed and also delete any corrupt files as they can slow your computer down alot…
I will try and find you a blank source now.

Read full topic

item.title: Low-ram help
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Their is no server that can do this, you really only have about 200-300mb or ram free since your most likely running windows xp which takes about 170-230 of that for a new install with all patches done. I suggest you buy more ram, a good site to use is tigerdirect.com I payed about $100 for my 3 gbs of ram.

Read full topic
